page.title: 16FLOWERS OF DOWNS AND WEALD
page.content: Throughout the year there are many different species of wild flower in this block. This account refers mostly to plants in flower in July. One of the most interesting families is the Orchids as they are quite rare in Britain. Most are an attractive light shade of lilac and deep purple in places, but do not smell as nice as they look. Older people say there are many more flowers when they were young. Their numbers dropped when farmers began to use chemical sprays. Now many are slowly coming back. {_________MOST COMMON FLOWERS__________ 1=Weald 2=Downs 3=Disused Railway {Campions 1,2,3, Buttercups 1,2,3, {Poppies 1, Daisies 2,3, Ox_eye daisies {2,3, cow parsley 1, hogweed 1, dog {roses 1,2, groundsel 1, thistles 1,2,3 {scarlet pimpernel 1, 3, clover 1, 3, {bird's foot trefoil 2.
